Examples¶

Overview¶

The embARC BSP platform comes with a large collection of examples using library and peripherals supported in embARC BSP. These examples provide a useful reference and starting point for embARC developers for their own applications. The .elf files of the following examples can be loaded through JTAG, or the .bin files through SD card by secondary bootloader.

  • Classic Samples
    • Blinky
  • ARC Feature Related Examples
    • ARC Cache Example
    • ARC Memory Protection Example
    • ARC Symmetric Multi-Processor (SMP) Example
    • ARC Timer Interrupt Example
    • ARC uDMA Example
    • ARC XY Memory Example

Application Note¶

The following application notes provide step-by-step instructions on a broad range of topics to familiarize you with the use of embARC BSP.

  • Quick start guide

  • Adding a new NT-Shell command

  • How to create your own peripheral modules for use with the ARC EMSK and embARC

  • Timer and ISR

  • Using a secondary bootloader on the EMSK

Note

Confirm that the version of embARC BSP and board is the correct one as noted in the application note documents
